text: It isn’t a coup either, imho, just a big circus

elements.text: It isn’t a coup either, imho, just a big circus

text: I think it can be hard to tell the difference when it's happening

elements.text: I think it can be hard to tell the difference when it's happening

text: but I think (hope?) you're right

elements.text: but I think (hope?) you're right

text: What part of people walking around in the capitol could lead to any transferral of power?

elements.text: What part of people walking around in the capitol could lead to any transferral of power?

text: A coup is something that gives privileged access to the means of power. Capitol is, after all, just a house. It’s not like the protesters are going to start writing laws

elements.text: A coup is something that gives privileged access to the means of power. Capitol is, after all, just a house. It’s not like the protesters are going to start writing laws

text: call it what you will, I think you'd be troubled too about the political process in your country if you had a wannabe strongman encouraging an armed mob to violently seize control of the building where parliamentary procedures necessary for a peaceful transfer of power are happening

elements.text: call it what you will, I think you'd be troubled too about the political process in your country if you had a wannabe strongman encouraging an armed mob to violently seize control of the building where parliamentary procedures necessary for a peaceful transfer of power are happening

text: I don’t mean to downplay that part and sorry if I came across that way. I’m deeply worried about the political process in the US too at the moment. I just don’t believe protesters in the capitol will lead to a shift of power - I don’t see the mechanism. A coup is normally when you use the military to take control of government infrastructure.

elements.text: I don’t mean to downplay that part and sorry if I came across that way. I’m deeply worried about the political process in the US too at the moment. I just don’t believe protesters in the capitol will lead to a shift of power - I don’t see the mechanism. A coup is normally when you use the military to take control of government infrastructure.

text: But as I wrote above there is a very real concern for the integrity of the american democracy when the president calls the validity of the  election where he lost into question

elements.text: But as I wrote above there is a very real concern for the integrity of the american democracy when the president calls the validity of the  election where he lost into question

text: Yeah

elements.text: Yeah

text: I think, to me, there's something different between pulling on all the legal and parliamentary levers vs. encouraging political violence

elements.text: I think, to me, there's something different between pulling on all the legal and parliamentary levers vs. encouraging political violence

text: but yeah it's all on a continuum I'm afraid

elements.text: but yeah it's all on a continuum I'm afraid

text: I agree with that too

elements.text: I agree with that too

text: I think "coup" implies a certain intentionality, and using that word highlights that this is not some kind of random boiling over of inexplicable rage that no one is to blame for, but rather the culmination of years of populist dogwhistling and disinformation

elements.text: I think "coup" implies a certain intentionality, and using that word highlights that this is not some kind of random boiling over of inexplicable rage that no one is to blame for, but rather the culmination of years of populist dogwhistling and disinformation

text: so whether or not this meets some kind of technical definition of a coup it feels important to call it that

elements.text: so whether or not this meets some kind of technical definition of a coup it feels important to call it that

text:
The "coup" language, I think comes from the fact that this violence is not an isolated phenomenon, it's connected to months of an election-losing political party telling its supporters that they did not lose, trying increasingly desperate maneuvers to overthrow the election, including members of the legislature today making baseless claims of fraud to block certification of the results.

Followed by the president essentially stoking this violence. If it was just a mob, then yeah, not a coup attempt. But the context matters

elements.text:
The "coup" language, I think comes from the fact that this violence is not an isolated phenomenon, it's connected to months of an election-losing political party telling its supporters that they did not lose, trying increasingly desperate maneuvers to overthrow the election, including members of the legislature today making baseless claims of fraud to block certification of the results.

Followed by the president essentially stoking this violence. If it was just a mob, then yeah, not a coup attempt. But the context matters

text: I also agree with all that. It’s just that - when you argue for using big words about stuff - you run out of words to describe the situation when he actually strolls into the oval office with a machine gun and a cigar with the military keeping the media and opposition at gunpoint.

elements.text: I also agree with all that. It’s just that - when you argue for using big words about stuff - you run out of words to describe the situation when he actually strolls into the oval office with a machine gun and a cigar with the military keeping the media and opposition at gunpoint.

text: The situation is so dramatic and insane - I agree with that - that we don’t need language that exaggerates it further

elements.text: The situation is so dramatic and insane - I agree with that - that we don’t need language that exaggerates it further

text: The most significant shift of power resulting from this is likely to be Pence’s last-minute maneuvers to take control of the republican party for the next election

elements.text: The most significant shift of power resulting from this is likely to be Pence’s last-minute maneuvers to take control of the republican party for the next election

text: That said, I think there is no doubt that the protesters - and possibly also Trump - would like it to be a coup

elements.text: That said, I think there is no doubt that the protesters - and possibly also Trump - would like it to be a coup

text: And I really wholeheartedly sympathize with your concern for the current political climate in your country (which is also important to me and so many others)

elements.text: And I really wholeheartedly sympathize with your concern for the current political climate in your country (which is also important to me and so many others)
